title: For Sale:  INCOG Appendix IWB Holster for Smith & Wesson M&P Shield 9
postcontent:
Up for sale is a lightly used G-Code INCOG holster for a S&W Shield. This holster is really sweet for appendix carry, which it is designed for. The kydex has a soft fuzzy coating on the outside which makes for more comfortable carry against the skin. Also has very solid, positive retention, which is adjustable. 

This holster has been slightly modified. I cut off the second belt clip (along the sight side of the holster), which digs into one's thigh when carried at 1 o'clock position. This clip removed makes the holster similar to what G-Code is now selling as the "Eclipse". 

I've switched to a different method of carry, and this holster doesn't work for me anymore, looking to pass it on.

This gun makes an excellent shooter and also has collectible value since it hasn't been altered and modified like most of them. If the ad is up it's still available, thanks for looking!

postcontent: For sale here is a very clean Used Benelli Super Black Eagle II 12 gauge shotgun with the left hand configuration! This shotgun was used very minimally by our Benelli Sales rep as a demo gun. Condition is Like New!! Features include the Max-4 camouflage finish, Comfortech recoil system in the stock, Crio 28 inch barrel, drilled and tapped receiver,  includes 5 Crio choke tubes, Red fiber optic front sight bead, mid sight bead, Semi automatic action, Manual safety, 3.5 inch chamber, and the inertia bolt system. The Super Black Eagle II is one of the most popular shotguns on the market with duck hunters! The 3.5 inch chamber allows shooters to shoot 2 3/4, 3, and 3 1/2 inch shells reliably. Condition on this gun is Like New with the factory case, owners manuals, chokes tubes, and choke tube wrench. Check out our pictures to see just how clean the gun really is! title: For Sale:  Beretta Model 21 Bobcat Magazine .22 LR Caliber Mec-Gar 7 Shot Blue Steel NIB MecGar 22 Long Rifle Model 21 Double Action Only will not fit model 950 Won’t fit 25 caliber pistols
postcontent: Seller Stock #: XMPB2107 No NYC. This listing is for ONE magazine, but winning buyer can take any number of extras we have available at the same per-mag price and no additional shipping charges. Here is Mec-Gar's blue steel 7 shot magazine for the Beretta model 21 Double Action Pistols chambered in .22 Long Rifle affectionately known as the Bobcat. We began stocking Mec Gar Magazines 20 years ago, not because some flashy sales rep came by, but because our knowledgeable local customers had tried them and endorsed them. Serious Combat and Target Handgunners of all types, from recreational target shooters to veteran police officers and Armed Services personnel, know and respect Mec-Gar's magazines. After all, they are the primary suppliers for Browning and Sig, and a major supplier for Smith & Wesson and Walther. Mec Gar magazines, writes the factory, are constructed from certified carbon steel and feature a heat treated housing and a hi-impact polymer or certified carbon steel follower and floorplate. To further complement this package, the surface is specially treated to ensure high corrosion resistance. Them work like they're supposed to: they insert smoothly, free-fall eject, and lock the slides open on big autos. We cannot say that about any other aftermarket magazines. They WILL NOT work on any other Beretta or Taurus Pistol besides the M-21 rimfire. On small rimfire pistols like these, it is even more crucial to have a reliable magazine. As our old teacher Joe Lowe used to say, without a magazine, it's just a single shot. And in our experience, without an original factory magazine or a Mec-Gar, there's a good chance it will be a single shot even with a magazine. Don't take that chance. Own One of them for only $ 24.00. Not for sale to residents of New York City. Any magazine deliveries into New York City require written permission from the Police Commissioner, so we cannot ship magazines into any of the six boroughs or 176 some odd zip codes, per NYC Code 10-131.10.Shipping.  Grips, Magazines, slings, holsters, scopes, mounts, parts & most any small light items, entire accessory orders only $10.00 total shipping no matter how many a person buys. $10.00 for an entire order, Not $10.00 per item or anything of the sort. $20 Flat Fee on magazine orders to Alaska, Hawaii, or Puerto Rico, and gun parts to PR civilians must ship to an FFL. Magazines and any small light non-gun items ride free with ammo orders. We accept checks with no more than 7 days hold. GA Pay, MC, Visa, Discover phone- or fax-in 7 3 1 9 8 9 4 7 2 3 orders, USPS Money Order items shipped ASAP please put your full information, venue number, and what the item is on any messages. Internet phone hours 8:00 – 5:00 CST Mon – Fri. Robertson Trading Post 117 Front Street PO Box 365 Henderson, Tennessee 38340. We buy, sell, and trade. Always have, since 1952.

postcontent: This is an Armscor 22lr rifle, that was made before the company changed its name.  Looks like the old M16, but is a very reliable semi auto .22lr rifle.  I believe it has a 12 round mag.   My supplier personally shot this one, and reports it is all good.  Bore is good. I did a minor restoration to the furniture. There was a lot of paint wear.  Now it looks very presentable.  Furniture still not completely smooth.  No cracks. Has finish wear on the flash suppressor, but not bad enough to justify refinishing.  There are 15 round and 25 round mags on the internet, and the Armscor Ak22 25rd mag will work with very slight modification.  Amrscor doesn't even make the regular stock M1600 anymore, although new ones can still be found.  Very easy gun to modify.  Everyone has moved onto the AR-15 look-alikes. postcontent:
250 NEW unfired factory-primed Lake City 7.62x51 (308) brass cases obtained from pulled-down (de-milled) USGI Military M80 ammo. Note that there may be various dates present in the mix...... dates seem to be from year, 10,11 &12 (may be others).... Neck resizing is strongly recommended to ensure a tight bullet fit.  
There may be residue of tar bullet sealant inside the case necks as is present in all de-milled military brass. In general, this residue will not affect case neck tension or ballistic performance. This is really nice, heavy-duty 7.62 brass.  Primed with CCI #34 Nato spec large rifle primers.

title: For Trade:  .375 H&H Safari Magnum; trade for shotgun
postcontent:
I have a beautiful custom rifle that I have never shot.  Also have approx. $1K in reloading components and factory ammo.  Would like to trade all for a shotgun which I WOULD shoot. Here is the old sales listing:

http://www.gunsamerica.com/918035884/CZ-550-Custom-375-H-H-Magnum.htm

"A very nice CZ 550 with custom work by AHR. The stock CZ set trigger has been replaced with AHR's great single stage trigger. The barrel cut to 22 1/2" and recrowned with a banded front sight and ivory bead with a standing leaf rear sight. A properly bedded McMillan stock rounds out this great rifle. The rifle is in exceptional condition with a superb bore! 
McMillan Stock Cheekpiece 22 1/2" Barrel Banded Front Sight w/Ivory Bead Standing Leaf Shallow "V" Rear Sight AHR Single Stage Trigger Straightened & Filled Bolt Handle"

Not a rifle similar to that one, but that very rifle.  I purchased it without the scope and rings for $1700 about three years ago, and thought I got a great deal.  Check out the AHR website to get an idea of the quality of their work!  I previously had 4 .375 H&H rifles: a Remington 700, Wichester M70 (one of the new FN-built ones from South Carolina), and two Ruger No.1's.  This rifle is head and shoulders above any of those.  A true, proper "dangerous game rifle", not a wannabe pretender.
I would like to trade for a 20 or 28 gauge Citori, but would consider almost any nice over/under suitable for skeet or sporting clays (already have a trap gun).  Would also consider a Remington 1100 or Beretta gas auto with cash added, or an interesting handgun (S&W 52, East German Mak) with cash added.  Or will sell outright. 
The reloading stuff includes LOTS of jacketed and cast bullets, lots of new and fired brass, 3 sets of dies, several thousand LR and LRM primers, jacketed bullet powder (4064,4895,4350), cast bullet powder (5744, 4759, RL7), and more.  Have about 5-6 boxes of premium factory ammo.
Again, pictured scope is not included.  Great rifle for Alaska or PNW.  Only rifle I've ever owned with a fiberglass stock; heavy and solid - nothing like the typical injection molded plastic stocks you see on most new rifles.

postcontent: Seller Stock #: XMSP574001NO MAGAZINE SALES into NEW YORK CITY This listing is for THREE magazines. Hit Buy It, and you’re buying 3, not 1. Hit Buy It 3 times, and you’re buying 9, and so on. In our experience, factory magazines work best, especially for Colt pistols. Like the pistols themselves, the factory mags are smooth and slick; they work like they're supposed to. For Colt Pistols, the factory magazines enhance their value for resale and collectability. That holds true for any other brand or clone of the venerable 1911 pistols; and this magazine works in any 1911 Government Pistol, including Colt Clones Armscor, Detonics, Kimber, Smith & Wesson, and Taurus. Manufacturer is most likely Check-Mate Industries of New York, principal factory magazine supplier for Colt Pistols and arch-competitor Smith & Wesson for many years. Construction is entirely stainless steel, from the top of the stainless cartridge follower to the bottom of the Rampant Colt factory logo floorplate. Each Magazine holds 8 rounds of .45 ACP / 45 Automatic Ammunition. Our onesy twosy single mag price is $39 each, and we usually have a separate ad on single mags. We're offering them, the real thing, in lots of 3 or more, however, for only $26 each. Own 3 for only $ 78.00. Not for sale to residents of New York City. Any magazine deliveries into New York City require written permission from the Police Commissioner, so we cannot ship magazines into any of the six boroughs or 176 some odd zip codes, per NYC Code 10-131.10. title: For Sale:  Bersa Thunder 380
postcontent: Bersa Thunder 380 in matte black (~250 rounds). Really nice little .380 ACP. The Argentine knock off of a Walther PPK. This is a DA/SA pistol that I bought new and still have the original box and everything that came with it, including the factory mag with finger extension. The Thunder 380 has a light aluminum alloy frame that reduces weight for easier carry, yet the pistol still retains enough mass (weight) to help tame recoil. The blowback, fixed-barrel design aids accuracy, and the nearly straight-in alignment of the chamber and the topmost cartridge in the magazine results in reliable chambering and cycling. The frame features a long rearward tang over the grips, which effectively protects the shooter's thumb web from hammer-bite or slide-bite. There are also several safety features built into the Bersa Thunder 380: a slide mounted manual safety and decocker that blocks the hammer, a magazine disconnect safety that prevents firing if a magazine is not inserted, a long double-action (DA) first trigger pull, an inertial firing pin, and an integral key-operated trigger lock. I also have 3 extra pro-mag extended magazines. These run ~$300 with only 1 mag. The extra mags run $20+ each, so I figure the value is ~$360-375. Looking for $350 for everything. Email me for additional pictures.If this is still posted, it is available. If you are NOT a NEVADA resident, with NEVADA ID showing you are over 21, and willing to sign a "bill of sale" certifying that you are legally eligible to own a firearm (or you don't hold a current Nevada CCW) then please don't waste my time.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Silenced Break Action Rifle and Streamlight TLR-1s
postcontent:
1. Gamo Whisper Silent Cat .177 Break-Action Rifle. This is one of the nicest Air Rifles for Pest Control/Small Game Hunting you can buy. It has a built on silencer that reduces 52% of noise (Legal on an Air Rifle), a Fluted barrel, Fiber Optic Iron Sights (green in rear/red in front), skelatanized stock, and recoil pad. It came with a cheap scope but I was at Academy one day and found a Display no-name scope I got them to sell me that is a 3x9x40 with BDC and finger turrets for $50 (they wanted $120) that is sighted in perfectly with the Benjamin pellets and is crystal clear. It has a scope riser to get above the iron sights as well I bought online. I also have several containers of high quality hunting ammo. I bought this for quiet pest control in my shop... it did well. This is in no way a BB gun toy, It is made for small game hunting and is more like a silent .22lr. It shoots 1200 fps with standard ammo and I believe 1400 fps with PBA pellets. I shoot regular because PBA goes supersonic (breaks the sound barrier) and makes the cracking sound the silencer cant help. It will come with some PBA ammo, but I use regular for the quietness and it is still very effective.

2. Streamlight TLR-1s with strobe/on/off. Less than 5 min of run time. I have just installed a new battery anyway when I took it off of a 1911 and installed on AR. It is like new and shows zero sign of performance or cosmetic ware. Perfect condition.

Coming to Birmingham Sat. 5/2 at some point.

Located in Auburn. Will meet a fair distance for trade, but will only sell locally. Prices are firm, I will not take less. Do not need to sell/trade, but will for the prices listed or am interested in trades.

The LCI (loaded chamber indicator) has been changed from the loud red one to a low profile black one. It looks much much better. I am including the stock LCI with it. Can easily be changed with a 1/16'' punch. (see pictures)

Comes with a Bladetech IWB holster for concealed carry. It has a single belt clip, made of kydex. (see pictures)

Included all the oem stuff; box, manual, cable lock, and two magazines.

Please do not email me asking me to call you, we can talk on email at least until we've agreed to meet. Please do not email me with just "I'm interested" as that gives me nothing. title: For Sale:  GLOCK G22
postcontent:
With a 4 1/2" barrel, and a total length of 7 1/3", this Gen 2 standard size pistol is a proven sidearm. 

Just the pistol and three (3) 15-round mags. 

Looks and shoots like every other 40 S&W GLOCK you've ever seen. 

GLOCK introduced the G22 .40 in 1990 and effectively closed the gap between the heavy .45 Auto, and the internationally proven 9x19. GLOCK was the first manufacturer to make this popular and effective round accessible for law enforcement agencies. Today, police agencies across the U.S., and countless others throughout the world, put their trust in this 15-round .40 caliber pistol.

One notable feature of the Glock 22, is the ability to change the caliber to .357 Sig with a simple barrel swap. This is possible due to the similar operating pressures of both rounds, and the fact that the .357 Sig is based on a .40 S&W case, necked down to accept .355 inch bullets. The Glock 22 can also be fitted with a converted .40 S&W to 9mm barrel and can operate as such using a Glock 9mm magazine. A .40 S&W to .22 LR conversion kit is also available for the Glock 22. (though NONE of these conversions kits are included with THIS pistol)

I'll take $475 for the pistol with all three (3) mags.

title: For Sale:  GLOCK G26
postcontent:
The so called "Baby Glock" has a 3 1/2" barrel, and a total length of 6.3".  This Gen 3 subcompact size pistol is a proven sidearm and a great option for either a back-up or concealed carry. 

Comes with original clam shell box, Galco Matrix 3x Kydex holster, a couple of regular (10-round) mags, and one extended (12-round) mag (plus the flat floor plate to convert it to a regular 10-round mag) [and everything else you see in the picture].  

GLOCK introduced the G26 in 1995 as a 9×19mm "subcompact" variant designed for concealed carry.  It features a smaller frame compared to the Glock 19, with a pistol grip that supports only two fingers, a shorter barrel and slide, and a double-stack magazine with a standard capacity of 10 rounds. A factory magazine with a +2 extension gives a capacity of 12 rounds. In addition, factory magazines from the Glock 17, Glock 18, and Glock 19, with capacities of 15, 17, 19, 31 and 33 rounds, will function in the Glock 26. More than simply a "shortened" Glock 19, design of the subcompact Glock 26 required extensive rework of the frame, locking block, and spring assembly that features a dual recoil spring.

I'll take $525 for this 9mm "subcompact" GLOCK in the box with all of the extras.

title: For Sale:  Grips S&W J Round Combat Sile Walnut Banana 1980s Production As New Smith & Wesson J or M Frame Round Butt Models 34 36 37 38 40 42 637 638 640 642 317 651
postcontent: Seller Stock #: GRsil711This listing is for One set of grips; buyers, however, may take as many extra sets as we have on hand at the same per-set price, and with no additional shipping charges. Most Smith & Wesson Revolvers manufactured after 1996 have Round Butt Grip Frames. If you aren’t sure which yours is, please see the comparative photo. Photos show representatives of only a couple dozen Italian Walnut grips we found in an old Southern Warehouse for any Smith & Wesson J frame revolver with a round butt grip frame. These include models 34 and 36, and their stainless counterparts models 63 and 60. These are excellent grips, and we sold lots of them during the 1960s until 1980s. These were imported by distinguished New York Importer Sile, Inc., and all of them are new, just occasionally with some slight signs of shelfwear from their years in the warehouse. What these do, shooting wise, is to increase the size of the grip on a J-Round and give the shooter better control, especially in Combat situations under stress for concealable revolvers. These grips’s heyday in the 1970s and 1980s saw them compete favorably with the much pricier factory Smith & Wesson grips that were hard to get at the time for any price. Photos show a vintage Michigan Police Supply special order Airweight Bodyguard with a set of these installed. Apart from that, they look good. These are all genuine cut-checkered Italian Walnut with stainless screws and screw escutcheons. These grips are period correct for any Smith & Wesson manufactured from the late 1960s through about 1995, and we consider them collectable in their own right. We’re offering these fine grips well below what similar bizarre looking competitors sell for. Own a set, the ones in the photos or a set of their identical mates for only $ 29.00. title: For Sale:  Smith & Wesson K or L Frame Grips Square Butt Service Magna Sile Italian Walnut New Old Stock 1980s Production
postcontent: Seller Stock #: GR5910301 This listing is for ONE set of grips, complete with grip screw. From an old east coast warehouse come these mint condition grips to fit Smith & Wesson K and L medium frame revolvers with Square Butt grip frames. Any shoppers unfamiliar with the difference between round and square butts, please see the comparative photo attached to this ad. Smith & Wesson K and L Frame includes Models 10, 13, 14, 15, 16, 17, 18, 19, 45, 48, 56, 64, 65, 66, 67, 68, 581, 586, 617, 648, 681 and 686 in square butt grip frame only, mostly manufactured prior to 1996. Model 12 owners may need a substantial amount of fitting, since many of the Model 12s have thinner-than-normal grip frames. These were manufactured in Italy, probably in Turin. Importer was Sile Distributors in New York. Type is Service Magna style revolver grip panels. Construction is genuine Italian Walnut, machine checkered on a very similar pattern to the S&W Factory Magnas issued from the mid 1960s until the mid 1990s. Chrome plated brass logo medallions show a Maltese Falcon motif. Grip Screw is nickel plated steel, secured by nickel plated brass escutcheon nuts. Surface detractions are negligible; neither these nor the factory Smith & Wesson Walnut or Goncalo grips were always cosmetically perfect. These grips have been in storage for a long time, over 25 years. Most of them came to us in their original thin paper Italian packaging. These grips are period correct for any Smith & Wesson K or L Square Butt revolver with D, or K, or A or B serial number prefixes. They will work on any K or L frame square butt Smith & Wesson Revolver. They will not work on a Round Butt Smith & Wesson. They will not work on a J Frame Smith & Wesson. They will not work on a Taurus revolver, or a Rossi, or a Colt. Replacement pricing on current production factory Smith & Wesson Magna grips approaches $75 for a set. We’re offering the Siles in the photos, however, or their substantially identical mates, each for only $ 39.00.
